The ballistics of this round is amazing. It delivers so much energy to the target. If you have never heard of the 300 AAC Blackout please do a little research and you will see what I'm talking about. This gun is amazing. This one is an Olympic Arms assault rifle calibered for 300 AAC Blackout. It has a 16 in. Heavy Duty Stainless Steel threaded barrel with thread cover, pop-up iron combat sights, UTG Foldable Metal Foregrip, a $350.00 Barska 1x30mm Electro Holographic sights with a infra red crosshair reticle with a 3x30 Magnifier, adjustable butt stock, an ergogrip pistol grip, free floating weaver rail, 1 30 round Magpul pmag and 1 30 round factory mag. I also have 100 rounds of this very scarce ammo, but It's easy to find on the internet. Just not easy to find in gun shops. It will also shoot 300 Whisper rounds.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Sig 556 DMR with 3-12x40 TufForce scope and Harris bipod
postcontent:
This rifle is used and has small marks behind the ejector from casings. It is upgraded with the Sig SWAT rail and also comes with the original Sig box, but I cannot find the manual (can be downloaded online I'm sure). Shipping will be $45.00 via USPS parcel services(shipping is my FFLs deal. I can't do anything about that). Must ship to an FFL, unless you want to buy it face to face. I will
accept cash, certified bank (cashiers) checks, or discreet PayPal (plus 3% for PayPal fees).

The rifle features a 21 inch military grade cold hammer-forged heavy contour barrel. (Same barrel design as the Sig550 DMR, only a bit shorter.) The rifle is chambered in 5.56 NATO, with a twist rate of 1 in 10 inches. The match grade heavy barrel features a target crown and matte black nitride finish for the ultimate in corrosion resistance. This rifle is upgraded with the SWAT quad-rail. The Picatinny rail equipped receiver is made of high strength steel with a durable wear-resistant Nitron-X finish. The trigger housing is machined from an aircraft grade aluminum alloy forging with a hard-coat anodized finish designed to survive extreme conditions. title: For Sale:  BULGARIAN AKSU KRINKOV 7.62x39 KIT for Milled Receiver
location: Branson West, MO area. (Springfield too), Springfield, Missouri
postcontent:
Virgin Bulgarian AKSU Krinkov 7.62x39mm Milled Receiver Kit. I bought this New, Sealed-In-Plastic, non-Serial Numbered Kit from K-VAR. The first person to commit to purchase will also get the Bulgy Krink green Sling, Bulgy 4-Cell  Mag Pouch for 4-AK47 30rd mags, and a Bulgy Krink Cleaning Rod. All three were extra and were not included in the kit.
  These 7.62x39 Kits are rare now and no longer available from K-VAR. Last time that K-VAR offered them, they were in the $1500+ range.
  This kit is pristine, has the correct 23mm barrel, and can be used for either milled or stamped receivers: (There's only 2 differences: the lack of a front trunnion, which can be found--use the Yugo M92 Krink front trunnion for a simple solution, or use any 23mm AK47 front trunnion and narrow the Hinged Receiver Cover Block by about .030", and it will fit. I can e-mail pics of exactly what needs to be narrowed. (small area)
  The other difference is the Handguard Set. I have the Stamped Receiver set in laminated wood, (awesome). Don't ask me why K-VAR sent me a Milled kit with Stamped Handguards, I didn't know until later on. But I wouldn't send them back, they're too nice. 
  If you're familiar with Krinks, you'll know that this is a great buy, a steal! The only reason I'm giving it up is because I've found one already built and don't need two. (I wish, but just can't keep two).

Congrats to the person that confirms and send funds first. This is ALL genuine Bulgarian, including the hammer-forged barrel. Thanks for your replies.

I have many pics of the kit and will send them to interested buyers upon request.

NOTE: Thanks, but no trades and $1200.00 is absolute FIRM.

FIRSTCHOICE

http://photobucket.com/bulgkrinkkit

title: For Sale:  Norinco -- PREBAN AK47 RED SIDE FOLDER FREE SHIPPING
postcontent: Ultra Rare,PREBAN NORINCO AKS RED SIDE FOLDER, semi auto AK type rifle, caliber 7.62x39mm.Serial # 100350 (as new, unfired, in original box and 3 magazines)an original pre-ban AKS (AK-47) rifle. Super RARE, You won't find these ANYWHERE! thumb button release, side folding metal stock assembly, All Red plastic stock components.Chrome bore. This style of AKS was one of the last versions imported by Norinco prior to the 1994 assault rifle ban and is much RARER than the Poly-Tech Legend or Polytech versions of AK rifles. It is estimated that less than 500 total of this model were ever imported into the US prior to the ban, which disallowed several features, one of them being the folding stock. These rifles were all manufactured by Norinco company which was the commercial side of the Chinese State Arms factory which produced the very best AKS rifles. It is reported that these rifles were imported in two groups; with approximately 250 in each shipment,the distinguishing feature being the shape of the pistol grip. As noted this rifle has the RARE molded all red plastic/fiberglass stock components; top handguard, forend, pistol grip and side plates for the folding stock. It is complete with the original numbered matching shipping box, three original NORINCO type 30 round magazines, canvas sling, cleaning kit and oiler bottle not shown but is included. Includes the original cleaning rod. Made with threaded muzzle, but with the bayonet lug like the milled "Legend" versions. A rare chance to get a premium, highly collectible, pre-ban AKS.

title: For Sale:  Mossberg 930 SPX Gen. 3 Tactical semi-auto shotgun w/pistol grip
postcontent:
930 SPX ((PISTOL GRIP MODEL)) Special Purpose Autoloading Tacactical Shotgun features 18 1/2" barrel, 7+1 capacity picatinny rail, magazine extension,  fully ajustable ghost ring rear sight, fiber optic front sight, factory paperwork, gun lock and a full length black synthetic stock with a pistol grip. This is the Gen. 3 model with the heavy duty barrel.. ALSO, I WILL INCLUED AROUND 75 ROUNDS OF 12GA. LOW / HIGH BRASS MISC. AMMO. 

PRICE IS FIRM @ $625 OR $600 LOCAL SALE IN WARSAW.

I WILL TRAVEL WITHIN 1 HOUR FROM WARSAW TO MEET..

The Mossberg 930 SPX Tactical has an aluminum receiver, a tactically sound 18.5” steel barrel, an extended magazine tube and a tough but lightweight synthetic stock. The gas-operated, semi-automatic shotgun is a direct descendant of the excellent Mossberg 930 hunting guns. The shared self-regulating gas operating system reduces recoil and eases stress on its components by venting whatever excess gas isn’t required to cycle the action.

The system uses two gas ports in the barrel to power a piston that surrounds the magazine tube under the barrel. The set-up gives the Mossberg a bit of a chunky for-end (to accommodate the moving parts), but nothing that looks out of place. The 930 SPX functions smoothly and reliably without a gas seal ring. An added bonus: the 930 SPX also field strips without a lot of drama.

title: For Sale/Trade:  1987 Smokercraft Deck Boat
postcontent: I have a 87 Smkoercraft deck boat for sale. We bought it early 2011 and put a new deck and stringers in it. Also replaced all of the expanding flotation foam in the hull. The deckk was covered with 2 coats of WHIT Herculiner truck bed liner for a waterproof durable coating. I also recover most of the seats with Marine grade vinyl red in color. It has a 4.3 liter OMC COBRA Inboard Outboard engine and lower unit. I serviced the lower unit last year with new synthetic lube and a new lower unit water pump. New fuel lines and in line fuel filter also installed. We only took the boat out 6 times last year, and wont be taking out anymore due to family situation changed and there will be no-one at home to watch and take out the dogs.... I have a clear title to the boat, the trailer does NOT have a title. I had it weighed so I could tag it. The registration on the boat is still good for 2 more years. The boat runs good, does 38 mph on the lake with the family on board. I also put in all new gauges and a high speed depth finder. It also has a marine grade cd plyer with auxillary inputs for usb or 3.5 mm plug. It is 19.5 feet in length, and gets lots of compliments. The last time we took it out was july of last year, we wanted to go more, but purchased a house that needed rehabed, so that took priority. The last time out, I got too close to the bank when we were at anchor and grinded the prop a bit on rocks. It just took a little off of the top end of one of the blades, and maybe 1 mph off of top speed. I will let everything go with the boat to make it water ready including life jackets sea doo brand sea scooters (2 of them), a single seater tube and rope. And the other things required by law. I am willing to take a partial trade for a firearm or 2, but not the entire amount. If you want to talk cash come and look at it. I do everything possible to not get into that via phone or email.

title: For Sale:  .455 Smith and Wesson MK II revolver 1916
location: Smithfield, Raleigh / Durham / CH, North Carolina
postcontent:
In excellent condition. Never tampered with, the serial number is on the cylinder. The action is really tight according to the gunsmith. It must have been a Generals side arm. 
In person sale a hand gun permit is required. Plus DL# and I will provide a bill of sale for both parties.
According to the Cruffler website: Some, like the Colt New Service and the Smith & Wesson .455 Hand Ejector were indigenous American designs.  These arms served the British and Commonwealth armies well, and were highly regarded by the soldiers to whom they were issued.  Indeed, in testament to the American guns' durability, reliability and accuracy under the worst conditions imaginable, a large number of British regimental museums today show the American guns, and not the British Webley, as an integral part of a First World Soldier's kit.  The martial .455 Colts and Smith & Wesson revolvers are highly collectible, as both examples of the epitome of the art of the revolver, and important historical artifacts in their own right.

Visit Miltech’s website (www.miltecharms.com price: $1650) for full details.  Manufactured in 1917 or 1918 by Remington Arms of Delaware, Eddystone, PA, more Model of 1917 rifles were issued to Doughboys in WWI than any other rifle. title: For Sale/Trade:  Like new Gen 4 Glock 26 with ammo and extras for ???
postcontent:
I have a like new, excellent condition Gen 4 Glock 26 with everything factory including 2 mags, 1 of the mags has the factory baseplate on and the other comes with a plus 2 capacity base plate.($25 value!) I also have the second factory flush base plate as well. I am also including a box ( 42 rounds ) of Hollowpoint ammo, and comes with a Brand new just purchased Houge grip, comes with 2 backstraps. It has been fired 50 rounds through it to function test, I just want a .40 or .45 for carry.


HERE IS SOME INFO ABOUT THE GUN FOR THOSE WHO DON'T KNOW:


The new Gen4 has several new features designed to satisfy the most demanding consumers. It is based on a full size G17/G22 MBS (multiple back strap) frame with a reduced short frame trigger mechanism housing. The multiple back strap system allows the user to change the circumference of the grip to fit their individual hand size. 
The grip has three options; a short frame version, medium frame or large frame that are easily changed and secured with a single pin.
The grip angle of the GLOCK “Safe Action” Pistol is not changed by back strap modifications. This ensures that the shooter does not shoot high or low when modifying the back strap or when shooting with a different GLOCK Pistol.



 The smallest back strap is integrated in the GLOCK MBS Frame reducing the trigger distance of the standard size frame by 2 mm. The medium back strap is a 2 mm back strap offering equal size of a standard frame. The large back strap is a 4 mm back strap. 

 The magazine release catch of the Gen4 is reversible and enlarged. The reversible magazine allows users to switch the catch to the left or right side of the pistol with no additional parts. 

 Additionally, the Gen4 has a new Rough Textured Frame (Gen4 RTF) surface designed to enhance grip traction and is present on the frame as well as the interchangeable back straps. 

 Internally, the original recoil spring has been replaced with a dual recoil spring assembly. The dual recoil spring assembly noticeably reduces the recoil while simultaneously increasing the life cycle of the assembly. . 



So to recap this package is going to come with:

Pierce +2 round extension for the magazine

Brand new Houge grip

42 rounds of 125 gr hollowpoint ammo


I am looking to trade for a

Glock 36 3rd gen (must be like new, no wear or scratches) 

Glock 27 3rd gen  (must be like new, no wear or scratches) 

Glock 26 3rd gen  (must be like new, no wear or scratches) 

Smith and Wesson M&P .40comapct or .45acp compact. must be in like new condition with everything factory.  

OR hit me up witha good offer for trade, HANDGUNS ONLY! No rifles or shotguns.


I will sell outright for $525 (I have over $60 in extras included)

title: For Sale:  WARNING ARMSLIST USERS----BEWARE OF SCAM
postcontent:
There is a scam being run on here by some individuals in the Decatur/Dekalb county area. Individuals using the name "Jasmine" and others. Messaging people trying to lure them down to the Dekalb County area to make the deal using excuses such as "I no longer have a vehicle so you will have to come to me".

Buy/trade at your own risk. Thought I would share. Have had several messages from the same individual, and once I tell them to take a hike I get a different message from another email address from the same area trying to buy from me.  BEWARE.

Remember, if it is too good to be true, it probably is.

title: For Sale:  Unconverted Saiga Rifle: 7.62 X 39mm SOLD! SOLD! SOLD! FIRM -NO TRADES
postcontent:
SOLD! SOLD! SOLD!

Saiga 7.62 X 39mm. Sold as you see in the photo with the exception of the scope.  The magazines and stock/handgrip are all US made and therefore constitute a "poor mans" 922 compliance for the time being. Converting this rifle would make a great father/son project. Illustrated photos and instructions on how to do so are freely all over the web.

I replaced the top cover with another one that has a built-in picatinny rail on it. Just mount your own scope and rings. The original cover is shown lying under the rifle in the photos below and will be included. The Barska 4-16X50 scope *IS NOT* included in this price, although it may be had as seen for an additional $100. It is an 'Green' illuminated sniper scope and this bad boy reeeeally zooms in.

This gun is a blast to shoot and has never had failures, stove-pipes, etc. You pull the trigger, it goes "boom". It's that simple. I am the second owner and estimate this gun to have fired somewhere very near 500 rounds only. It is by no means a worn-out rag. If you want to get attention at the range, this will do it. Most people have no idea what it is.

I would not get rid of it but I just don't shoot it that much and would rather generate funds for other firearms projects. I'm not starving. Lowballers can go take a flying leap and will be ignored, not cheerfully either.

It comes with three 30 round mags and three 10 round mags. I also have about 600 rounds of Silverbear non-corrosive, berdan-primed ammo for sale for $135. The ammo will not be sold separately unless the prospective rifle buyer declines it.

Price $400 FIRM without scope. $500 FIRM with scope and rings as seen. FTF in Clark County with DL and LTCH in hand so I can make sure I'm not selling to a felon. 

Feel free to email any questions. Thanks for looking.

postcontent:
930 SPX ((PISTOL GRIP MODEL)) Special Purpose Autoloading Tacactical Shotgun features 18 1/2" barrel, 7+1 capacity, picatinny rail, magazine extension, fully ajustable ghost ring rear sight, fiber optic front sight, factory paperwork, gun lock and a full length black synthetic stock with a pistol grip. This is the Gen. 3 model with the heavy duty barrel.. ALSO, I WILL INCLUED  75 ROUNDS OF 12GA. AMMO. 

PRICE IS FIRM @ $625 OR $600 LOCAL SALE IN WARSAW.

I WILL TRAVEL WITHIN 1 HOUR FROM WARSAW TO MEET ((FTF ONLY))..

The Mossberg 930 SPX Tactical has an aluminum receiver, a tactically sound 18.5” steel barrel, an extended magazine tube and a tough but lightweight synthetic stock. The gas-operated, semi-automatic shotgun is a direct descendant of the excellent Mossberg 930 hunting guns. The shared self-regulating gas operating system reduces recoil and eases stress on its components by venting whatever excess gas isn’t required to cycle the action.

The system uses two gas ports in the barrel to power a piston that surrounds the magazine tube under the barrel. The set-up gives the Mossberg a bit of a chunky for-end (to accommodate the moving parts), but nothing that looks out of place. The 930 SPX functions smoothly and reliably without a gas seal ring.
